text: HRdy 744 TTHNf xifeasrut 3414 _ Phone 91.11-25074100/25074200 (ev 4arT ait TToTrif +Arqta) Taf Fax 91.11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) a-5 Q 6, Warr-10 , ETra5T , 7 farf-110075 6-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No.11041/218/2007-Admn Dated: |9 .02.2016 PQLICY MATTERS-Administration[Finance (1Z0[20162 (Decision taken in File No.NHAI/Legal/Opinion-4/974/2015) Sub: The Control of   National   Highways (Land & Traffic) 2002 (13 of   2003) Implementation Regarding: This is in continuation of NHATs Policy Circular Administration Finance (100/2005) , dated 09.03.2005 vide which all the PDs were requested to g0 through The provisions of the Control of National Highways (Land & traffic) Act 2002 (13 of 2003) [hereinafter referred to as the 'Act'] and Highway Administration Rules 2004 [hereinafter referred to as the Rules], but a review in the matter reveals that the provisions of the Act and the Rules are not being effectively implemented by Project Directors. 2 The Act was enacted by the Parliament in the 2003 and came into force  vide Government of India Gazette Notification dated 15.01.2003. The Act empowers the Central Government to establish Highway Administrations u/s 3(1). Accordingly, Ministry of Road Transport & Highways established 192 Highway Administrations throughout the country and notified vide Gazette Notification dated 20.01.2005. Subsequently MoRT&H, in supersession of the aforesaid Notification dated 20.01.2005, established 16   Highway Administrations and these were notified vide Gazette Notification dated 02.06.2015. In order to control unauthorized occupation of land and unauthorized access and also to regulate the traffic on National Highways, the provisions of the Act must be implemented by the PDs, who have been designated as Authorized Officer' of Highway Administration. Among other points, there is need for NHAI Officers to pay speeial attention to: Delegation of powers to the Project Directors of NHAI (ii) Removal of unauthorised Occupation Removal of unauthorised Access Criminal prosecution for repeat offences Regulation of Traffic 3_ Delegation of Powers to PDs: The Highway Administrations are empowered under Section 20(1)(c) , to appoint, with the approval of Central Government, by notification in the official gazette officers of the National Highway Authority of India to exercise such powers and discharge such functions of the Highway Administration, as may be   specified in the Notification As per the extant procedure adopted by MoRTH, powers and functions of the Highway Administration under Section 24, 25, 26, 27 & 43 of the Act are delegated to the Project Directors of NHAI within their respeetive jurisdiction.
